Exaggerate: The claim exaggerates the potential consequences of the Obama administration's actions by stating that control of the internet will be given away to an international body akin to the United Nations.
Understate: The claim may understate the complexity and planned nature of the shift in control of the internet, as described by proponents including ICANN and administration officials.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks sufficient evidence or support to back up the assertion that the Obama administration intends to give away control of the internet.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that giving control of the internet to an international body would be detrimental, without providing evidence or reasoning to support this assumption.
Exist alternative explanation: The claim does not consider alternative explanations or perspectives for the shift in control of the internet, such as the desire to involve the greater world community and address concerns raised by the Snowden revelations.
